lv.emes.libraries.file_system

Class MS_FileSystemTools

  • java.lang.Object
    • lv.emes.libraries.file_system.MS_FileSystemTools

  • public class MS_FileSystemTools
extends java.lang.Object
    Different transformations and actions related with OS file system.

    Static methods: -executeApplication -getPathToPackage -getPathToSourcePackage -getTmpDirectory -getProjectDirectory -fileExists -directoryExists -createEmptyFile -getFilenameWithoutExtension -getFileExtensionWithDot -getFileExtensionWithoutDot -getDirectoryOfFile -getShortFilename -deleteFile

    Version:
    0.9.

      • SOURCE_FOLDER

        public static java.lang.String SOURCE_FOLDER
        Path starting from root directory of project to source (mostly "src") folder.

        It's used together with method getPathToPackage as a prefix (first parameter).

        See Also:
        getPathToPackage(java.lang.Class<?>)

    • Method Detail

      • executeApplication

        public static boolean executeApplication(java.lang.String fileName,
                                         java.lang.String params)
        Launches application named fileName using OS Runtime process runner, ProcessBuilder for batch handling or Desktop to open hyperlinks. Capabilities of this method are described in lv.emes.libraries.file_system.MS_FileSystemTools.executeApplication capabilities.xls.

        WARNING: Currently there is problems with filenames or folders with spaces, so try not to use such paths!

        Note: After batch file execution command line or terminal window is remaining open. To close this window after execution, just add line "exit" in your batch script file!

        Parameters:
        fileName - full path (including directory) to executable file, directory or application. Also relative path without spaces is fully supported.
        params - command line or application parameters delimited with spaces for process to execute. Leave empty if application don't have any parameter!
        Returns:
        true if successfully sent command to OS (in some cases that doesn't mean that process actually executed, but OS definitely received command to execute application).
        It returns false in cases when cannot find application, process, file or folder with passed fileName or when some other error occurs.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - when fileName or params is null.
        See Also:
        Runtime, ProcessBuilder, Desktop

      • getTmpDirectory

        public static java.lang.String getTmpDirectory()
        Returns:
        path to system default temporary folder.

      • getResourceInputStream

        public static java.io.InputStream getResourceInputStream(java.lang.String resourceFilename)
        When using project resources folder this is best way to get access to files stored there. By using this method you can get direct path to specified resource through it's short path (searching starts from folder "resources").
        Note: resource must be for read only and it must be prepared before launching any script that gets it.
        Parameters:
        resourceFilename - = "folder/file.txt"
        Returns:
        full path to a file "file.txt" located in "src/main/resources/" or in "resources/" (depending on project config).

        If resource cannot be found, returns empty String.

      • getPathToSourcePackage

        public static java.lang.String getPathToSourcePackage(java.lang.Class<?> aClass)
        Returns path to package which contains given class aClass.
        Parameters:
        aClass - = MS_FileSystemTools.class
        Returns:
        SOURCE_FOLDER + "lv/emes/file_system/"

      • getPathToPackage

        public static java.lang.String getPathToPackage(java.lang.Class<?> aClass)
        Returns path to package which contains given class aClass.

        This particular method doesn't return full path name (including path to source folder) to package. But another version of this method getPathToSourcePackage does.

        Parameters:
        aClass - = MS_FileSystemTools.class
        Returns:
        "lv/emes/file_system/"
        See Also:
        getPathToSourcePackage(java.lang.Class<?>)

      • getPathToPackage

        public static java.lang.String getPathToPackage(java.lang.String prefix,
                                                java.lang.Class<?> aClass)
        Returns path to package which contains given class aClass. First parameter is prefix or path from project directory to particular package.

        Before use it's recommended to set MS_FileSystemTools.SOURCE_FOLDER and use it as first parameter.

        Also it is possible to simply call getPathToSourcePackage, passing just aClass as parameter; prefix automatically will be set to SOURCE_FOLDER.

        Parameters:
        prefix - a custom text that will be added before path, can be used to pass path to source folder in which package is located.
        aClass - MS_FileSystemTools.class.
        Returns:
        prefix + "lv/emes/file_system/".
        See Also:
        getPathToSourcePackage(java.lang.Class<?>)

      • getProjectDirectory

        public static java.lang.String getProjectDirectory()
        Returns:

      • createEmptyFile

        public static boolean createEmptyFile(java.lang.String aFileName)
        Atomically creates a new, empty file named by this abstract pathname if and only if a file with this name does not yet exist. The check for the existence of the file and the creation of the file if it does not exist are a single operation that is atomic with respect to all other filesystem activities that might affect the file. Note: this method should not be used for file-locking, as the resulting protocol cannot be made to work reliably. The FileLock facility should be used instead.
        Parameters:
        aFileName - - path + short filename, in other words: full path to file.
        Returns:
        true if the named file does not exist and was successfully created; false if the named file already exists

      • getFilenameWithoutExtension

        public static java.lang.String getFilenameWithoutExtension(java.lang.String aFilename)
        Parameters:
        aFilename - = "test.txt"; "without extension"; "text.txt."
        Returns:
        "test"; "without extension"; "text"

      • getFileExtensionWithDot

        public static java.lang.String getFileExtensionWithDot(java.lang.String aFilename)
        Parameters:
        aFilename - name of file. For example, "test.file"
        Returns:
        only extension of file with dot. Like ".file".

      • getFileExtensionWithoutDot

        Parameters:
        aFilename - name of file. For example, "test.file"
        Returns:
        only extension of file without dot. Like "file".

      • getDirectoryOfFile

        public static java.lang.String getDirectoryOfFile(java.lang.String aFilename)
        From full filename gets directory in which file is found.
        Parameters:
        aFilename - directory + path to a file.
        Returns:
        path to directory or "./" if only short filename given as parameter aFilename.

      • getShortFilename

        public static java.lang.String getShortFilename(java.lang.String aFilename)
        From full filename gets filename without path to directory.
        Parameters:
        aFilename - directory + path to a file.
        Returns:
        just filename (with extension).

      • deleteFile

        public static boolean deleteFile(java.lang.String filename)
        Silently deletes file from file system. If file doesn't exist, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        filename - name of file to be deleted.
        Returns:
        true if delete successful, false if file couldn't be found or deleted.
